document_title: Delayed labor: Causes, signs of recognition and treatment
subsection_content:
Based on the labor chart:
The cervical opening line is to the right of the alarm line (early) or crosses the action line (late).; Uterine contractions with a frequency of 3/10 minutes but after 4 hours there is no progress in penetration.
Clinically based:
The head has overlapping bones and serous humps; Often accompanied by fetal distress; The mother shows signs of dehydration and acidosis (urine contains acetone). The amount of urine monitored in 4 hours is less than 100ml.; Depending on how early or late labor appears, the uterus will be stretched, the spasm will appear, the bladder will be stretched, and the colon will be bulging.
subsection_title: chuyen da dinh tre.json. Diagnosis of delayed labor
